Pre-Game Insights: The Atlanta Braves are 74-61 this year and they have won four of their last five games. Atlanta lost game one in this series, but they won game two by a score of 7-2 on Friday.
The Philadelphia Phillies are 79-56 this season and they have alternated wins and losses in their last four games. Philadelphia won game one in this series by a score of 5-4 but lost on Friday.

The projected starting pitcher for Atlanta is Max Fried, who is 8-7 with a 3.50 ERA and a 1.20 WHIP over 133.2 innings pitched this year. Fried has allowed two earned runs or fewer in two straight starts, including a very solid start against the Phillies.

The projected starting pitcher for Philadelphia is Zack Wheeler, who is 12-6 with a 2.74 ERA and a 1.00 WHIP over 160.2 innings pitched this season. Wheeler has allowed two earned runs or fewer in five straight starts.
Post-Match Reflections: No post-match reflections are provided in the article.
